alert.note: Alert for Bell; Clay; Knox; Laurel; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 1:58AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Laurel, central Bell, Knox, north central Whitley and southern Clay Counties through 230 AM EDT... At 158 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Arkle, or near Barbourville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Baileys Switch, Jarvis, Cranes Nest and Tedders around 205 AM EDT. Barbourville, Cannon, Heidrick, Fletcher, Swanpond and Sprule around 210 AM EDT. Hinkle, Girdler, Bimble, Yeager, Green Road, Boone Heights, Fount, Artemus, Brush Creek and Haven around 215 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Baughman, Himyar, Avis, Barnyard, Hammond, Old Flat Lick, Flat Lick, Walker, Scalf, Dewitt, Salt Gum, Mills, Erose, Field, Rella, Blanche and Fourmile. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
